Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.gameboard

Class Warehouse

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.observer.Observable
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.gameboard.Warehouse
public class Warehouse
extends Observable
Class Warehouse represents the warehouse on the game board. Its shelves are represented as a list of ResourceQuantity objects. Note that a depot leader is considered a shelf of the warehouse.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type Field Description

    private java.lang.String owner  
    private java.util.List<ResourceQuantity> warehouse

      private final java.util.List<ResourceQuantity> warehouse

      private final int initialDim

      private final java.lang.String owner

  • Constructor Details

    • Warehouse

      public Warehouse​(int warehouseDim, java.lang.String nickname)
      Default constructor. Creates a warehouse object with a specified amount of initial shelves.
      Parameters:
      warehouseDim - the initial number of shelves
      nickname - the nickname of the player who owns this warehouse object

  • Method Details

    • notifyNew

      public void notifyNew​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Notifies a player's virtual view with a NewWarehouse message. Used when a player is reconnecting to a game.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player to notify

    • getWarehouse

      public java.util.List<ResourceQuantity> getWarehouse()
      Returns a copy of the warehouse.
      Returns:
      the list of ResourceQuantity objects representing the shelves of the warehouse

    • getShelf

      public ResourceQuantity getShelf​(NumOfShelf numOfShelf)
      Returns the copy of a shelf of the warehouse, also considering depot leaders.
      Parameters:
      numOfShelf - the shelf to copy
      Returns:
      the copy of the specified shelf

    • incrementResource

      public void incrementResource​(java.util.List<ResourcePosition> outputRes)
      Adds resources in the shelves from a specified list of ResourcePosition objects. Safety is guaranteed if this method is called after checkIncrement(List), if the latter does not throw an exception. It also notifies all the players' virtual views with a NewWarehouse message.
      Parameters:
      outputRes - that list of resources that need to be added to the warehouse

    • checkIncrement

      public void checkIncrement​(java.util.List<ResourcePosition> outputRes) throws WrongActionException
      Checks if the resources contained in the provided list can be added to the warehouse.
      Parameters:
      outputRes - the list of resources to add to the chest
      Throws:
      WrongActionException - when one of the game rules of the warehouse is broken

    • calculateQuantity

      private int calculateQuantity​(java.util.List<ResourcePosition> inputRes, ResourcePosition Rp)
      Returns the number of resources contained in the provided list of the same type as the ResourcePosition object provided that have the same NumOfShelf attribute.
      Parameters:
      inputRes - the list of ResourcePosition objects
      Rp - the ResourcePosition object the list will be compared to
      Returns:
      the number of resources computed

    • decrementResource

      public void decrementResource​(java.util.List<ResourcePosition> inputRes)
      Removes resources from the shelves. Safety is guaranteed if this method is called after checkDecrement(List) if the latter does not throw an exception. It also notifies all the players' virtual views with a NewWarehouse message.
      Parameters:
      inputRes - the list of resources that need to be removed

    • checkDecrement

      public void checkDecrement​(java.util.List<ResourcePosition> inputRes) throws WrongActionException
      Checks if the resources contained in the provided list can be removed from the warehouse.
      Parameters:
      inputRes - the list of resources to remove from the warehouse
      Throws:
      WrongActionException - when one of the game rules of the warehouse is broken

    • moveResource

      public void moveResource​(NumOfShelf srcShelf, NumOfShelf destShelf, int quantity)
      Moves a certain number of resources from one shelf to another.
      Parameters:
      srcShelf - the source shelf
      destShelf - the destination shelf
      quantity - the amount of resources to move

    • decrementWithoutNotify

      private void decrementWithoutNotify​(java.util.List<ResourcePosition> inputRes)
      Removes resources from the shelves.
      Parameters:
      inputRes - the list of resources that need to be removed

    • checkMove

      public void checkMove​(NumOfShelf srcShelf, NumOfShelf destShelf, int quantity) throws WrongActionException
      Checks if a certain amount of resources can be moved from one shelf to another.
      Parameters:
      srcShelf - the source shelf
      destShelf - the destination shelf
      quantity - the amount of resources to move
      Throws:
      WrongActionException - when one of the game rules of the warehouse is broken

    • checkMoveDepot

      private boolean checkMoveDepot​(Resource resource, NumOfShelf shelf)
      Checks if there is another shelf storing a specified resource that is not a depot leader and it's different from the shelf provided.
      Parameters:
      resource - the specified resource
      shelf - the provided shelf
      Returns:
      true if the condition is met, false otherwise

    • checkOtherShelves

      private boolean checkOtherShelves​(Resource resource, NumOfShelf numOfShelf)
      Checks if there is another shelf storing a specified resource that is not a depot leader and it's different from the shelf provided.
      Parameters:
      resource - the specified resource
      numOfShelf - the provided shelf
      Returns:
      true if the condition is met, false otherwise

    • addDepot

      public void addDepot​(Resource resource)
      Adds a shelf derived from the depot leader card. It also notifies all the players' virtual views with a NewWarehouse message.
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource stored by the leader card

    • checkDepot

      public boolean checkDepot​(Resource resource)
      Checks if there is already a depot storing the same resource as the one provided.
      Parameters:
      resource - the provided resource
      Returns:
      true if there is a depot storing the provided resource, false otherwise

    • getAvailability

      public int getAvailability​(Resource resource)
      Returns the amount of resources of the type provided stored in the warehouse.
      Parameters:
      resource - the type of resource
      Returns:
      the amount of resources of the desired type stored in the warehouse
